intro: Primulina qingyuanensis, commonly known as the Qingyuan stone orchid, is a rare and unique species native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological niches. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of pink and white, are pollinated primarily by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
